triples.name: Language model
triples.relevance: LaMDA is built on the language model architecture and pre-training paradigm.

triples.name: Dialogue system
triples.relevance: LaMDA is specifically designed to handle dialogue applications.

triples.name: Transformer (deep learning)
triples.relevance: LaMDA uses Transformer-based neural network architecture as its foundation.

triples.name: Fine-tuning (deep learning)
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates fine-tuning with annotated data to improve safety and factual grounding.

triples.name: Information retrieval
triples.relevance: LaMDA consults information retrieval systems as one of its external knowledge sources.

triples.name: Machine translation
triples.relevance: LaMDA uses language translators as external knowledge sources for grounding responses.

triples.name: Crowdsourcing
triples.relevance: LaMDA uses crowdworker-annotated data to fine-tune safety classifiers.

triples.name: Algorithmic bias
triples.relevance: The paper addresses unfair bias as a key safety challenge for dialogue models.

triples.name: Knowledge graph
triples.relevance: Knowledge sources and external information structures support factual grounding in LaMDA.

triples.name: LaMDA
triples.relevance: LaMDA is the novel family of dialogue-specialized language models proposed and evaluated in the paper.
